channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: Microsoft investigates OneDrive bug that breaks file search
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Microsoft OneDrive; CVE(s): None; Summary: Some OneDrive users are experiencing blank search results or no results at all, even when searching for files they know exist. The issue affects a subset of users across most OneDrive platforms and there is currently no known workaround or estimated timeline for a fix.
FYSA:

item.title: Cloudflare blocks record 7.3 Tbps DDoS attack against hosting provider
item.description: Cloudflare mitigated a record-breaking distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack in May 2025 that peaked at 7.3 Tbps, targeting a hosting provider. The attack used multiple vectors, including UDP floods, QOTD reflection, Echo reflection, NTP amplification, Mirai botnet UDP flood, Portmap flood, and RIPv1 amplification, each exploiting legacy or poorly configured services.

item.title: Aflac discloses breach amidst Scattered Spider insurance attacks
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Aflac; CVE(s): None; Summary: The systems of American insurance giant Aflac were breached by a sophisticated cybercrime group, potentially stealing personal and health information. The attack shows signs of being carried out by Scattered Spider, a group known for their social engineering attacks against high-profile organizations worldwide.
Note: There is no specific vulnerability mentioned in the article, so no CVEs are listed.

item.title: Can users reset their own passwords without sacrificing security?
item.description: The article discusses the benefits of self-service password reset (SSPR) solutions in reducing helpdesk load, costs, and improving productivity. It highlights the importance of proper security considerations when implementing an SSPR solution, including strong identity verification measures and multi-factor authentication (MFA). The article also emphasizes the need for a user-friendly experience to promote adoption and minimize abandonment.

item.title: Massive DDoS Attack Hits 7.3 Tbps Delivering 37.4 Terabytes in 45 Seconds
item.description: A massive distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack peaked at 7.3 terabits per second (Tbps), overwhelming its target with 37.4 terabytes of data in just 45 seconds, targeting an unnamed hosting provider that relied on Cloudflare's Magic Transit service for network defense.

item.title: Microsoft to remove legacy drivers from Windows Update for security boost
item.description: This article is not about a specific vulnerability, but rather discusses Microsoft's plan to periodically remove legacy drivers from the Windows Update catalog to mitigate security and compatibility risks. The company aims to ensure the optimal set of drivers on Windows Update while maintaining its security posture.

item.title: Azure Misconfiguration Lets Attackers Take Over Cloud Infrastructure
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Azure; CVE(s): None; Summary: A chain of misconfigurations in Microsoft Azure allows attackers to gain complete control over an organization's cloud infrastructure, from initial access to full tenant takeover. The attack path involves unauthenticated reconnaissance, exploiting public storage accounts, and leveraging dynamic group membership rules to achieve privilege escalation and lateral movement, ultimately leading to total ownership of the Azure environment.

item.title: Iran's State TV Hijacked Mid-Broadcast Amid Geopolitical Tensions; $90M Stolen in Crypto Heist
item.description: Iran's state-owned TV broadcaster was hacked to air videos calling for street protests against the Iranian government, while Israel accused Iran of launching cyber attacks. The incident is part of a larger cyber war between Israel and Iran that has been ongoing for over a decade.

item.title: AntiDot 3-in-1 Android Botnet Malware Grants Attackers Full Control Over Victim Devices
item.description: AntiDot is a new Android botnet malware that grants cybercriminals control over infected devices. It has advanced capabilities such as screen recording, SMS interception, and credential theft through overlay attacks. The malware operates through at least 11 active command-and-control (C2) servers, managing over 3,775 infected devices across 273 distinct campaigns.

item.title: Oxford City Council Hit by Cyberattack Exposing Employee Personal Data
item.description: Oxford City Council's network was targeted by a sophisticated cyberattack that exposed personal data of employees involved in council-administered elections over the past two decades. The attack allowed attackers to access historic data stored on legacy systems, affecting current and former council officers.

item.title: Versa Director Flaws Let Attackers Execute Arbitrary Commands
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Versa Networks' SD-WAN orchestration platform, Versa Director; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23171, CVE-2025-23172; Summary: Authenticated attackers can upload malicious files and execute arbitrary commands on affected systems due to insecure file upload and webhook functionalities. The first flaw allows remote code execution (RCE) if a webshell is uploaded and accessed, while the second vulnerability enables authenticated users to execute commands as the "versa" user with sudo privileges.

item.title: GodFather Android Malware Uses On-Device Virtualization to Hijack Legitimate Banking Apps
item.description: The GodFather Android banking malware creates a fully isolated virtual environment on the victim's device, enabling attackers to monitor and manipulate user interactions in real-time. It employs a malicious "host" application that downloads and runs a copy of the targeted app within a controlled sandbox, capturing credentials and sensitive information with precision.

item.title: ZDI-25-411: Delta Electronics CNCSoft-G2 DPAX File Parsing Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Delta Electronics CNCSoft-G2; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47728; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Delta Electronics CNCSoft-G2. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of DPAX files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to a memory corruption condition.

item.title: ZDI-25-412: Fuji Electric Smart Editor X1 File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fuji Electric Smart Editor X1; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41413; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Fuji Electric Smart Editor by writing past the end of an allocated data structure. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-413: Fuji Electric Smart Editor TL5 File Parsing Stack-Based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fuji Electric Smart Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41388; Summary: The Fuji Electric Smart Editor TL5 file parsing stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations, requiring user interaction. The flaw exists in the processing of TL5 files due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length buffer.

item.title: Resurgence of the Prometei Botnet
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Prometei Linux Botnet; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Prometei malware family, which includes both Linux and Windows variants, allows attackers to remotely control compromised systems for cryptocurrency mining (particularly Monero) and credential theft. The latest versions feature a backdoor that enables a variety of malicious activities, including brute-forcing administrator credentials, exploiting vulnerabilities, and self-updating features for stealth and evasion.

item.title: 6 Steps to 24/7 In-House SOC Success
item.description: Threat actors often target businesses during off-hours when security personnel are fewer or not present. A 24/7 Security Operations Center (SOC) can provide real-time threat detection and resolution, but requires a perfect balance of proven processes, advanced tools, and skilled professionals.

item.title: Massive 7.3 Tbps DDoS Attack Delivers 37.4 TB in 45 Seconds, Targeting Hosting Provider
item.description: Cloudflare reported blocking a 7.3 Tbps DDoS attack, targeting an unnamed hosting provider, which used a combination of UDP flood, QOTD reflection attack, echo reflection attack, NTP reflection attack, Mirai UDP flood attack, portmap flood, and RIPv1 amplification attack. The attack originated from over 122,145 source IP addresses across 161 countries, with the largest portions coming from Brazil, Vietnam, Taiwan, China, Indonesia, Ukraine, Ecuador, Thailand, the United States, and Saudi Arabia.

item.title: Microsoft Introduces Enhanced Security Defaults for Windows 365 Cloud PCs
item.description: Microsoft is introducing new secure-by-default capabilities for Windows 365 Cloud PCs to fortify virtual desktop environments against modern cyber threats. The update includes default disabling of device redirections (clipboard, drive, USB, and printer) and enabling advanced security controls such as virtualization-based security, Credential Guard, and hypervisor-protected code integrity.

item.title: Dover Fueling Solutions Flaw Lets Attackers Control Fueling Operations
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Dover Fueling Solutions' ProGauge MagLink LX consoles; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5310; Summary: The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-5310, allows remote attackers to seize control of fueling operations, manipulate tank monitoring, and deploy malware, posing a severe risk to transportation systems worldwide.

item.title: 16 Billion Passwords Stolen From 320 Million+ Computers Leaked Online
item.description:
A massive data breach has exposed approximately 16 billion login credentials, usernames, and passwords across various platforms, including Apple, Facebook, Google, Instagram, Telegram, GitHub, and government services. The compromised data can be used for account takeover, identity theft, targeted phishing attacks, and ransomware attacks.
FYSA: Cybercriminals have gained access to a massive dataset of login records, which can be exploited for account takeovers, identity theft, and targeted phishing attacks.

item.title: IBM QRadar SIEM Bug Lets Attackers Run Arbitrary Commands
item.description: Vulnerable Product: IBM Security QRadar SIEM; CVE(s): CVE-2025-33117, None (other CVEs mentioned are not explicitly linked to the vulnerability); Summary: A critical flaw in IBM's QRadar SIEM platform allows privileged users to execute arbitrary commands on affected systems, enabling attackers to compromise sensitive data or gain unauthorized access. The vulnerability has been addressed in the latest interim fix (UP12 IF02), and customers are urged to update their installations to protect against potential exploitation.

item.title: 200+ Trojanized GitHub Repositories Found in Campaign Targeting Gamers and Developers
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a new campaign of 67 GitHub repositories claiming to offer Python-based hacking tools, but delivering trojanized payloads instead. The repositories were taken down by GitHub, and the campaign is believed to target users searching for software such as account cleaning tools and game cheats.

item.title: Apache SeaTunnel Flaw Lets Unauthorized Users Launch Deserialization Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache SeaTunnel; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32896; Summary: The Apache SeaTunnel vulnerability (CVE-2025-32896) allows unauthorized users to exploit insecure REST API endpoints, enabling arbitrary file read and potentially remote code execution through deserialization attacks. This affects versions 2.3.1-2.3.10 and has been classified as moderate to critical in severity, depending on deployment context.

item.title: Tesla Wall Connector Hacked Through Charging Port in Just 18 Minutes
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Tesla Wall Connector; CVE(s): None; Summary: Security researchers from Synacktiv successfully hacked the Tesla Wall Connector through its charging port in just 18 minutes, exposing critical vulnerabilities in the device's firmware and communication protocols. The attack involved downgrading the Wall Connector's firmware to an older version with exposed debug features, including a TCP debug shell accessible over Wi-Fi, and exploiting a global buffer overflow in the shell's command parsing logic for code execution.

item.title: Malicious Support Tickets Let Hackers Exploit Atlassian’s Model Context Protocol
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Atlassian Jira Service Management (JSM); CVE(s): None; Summary: A new class of cyberattack targets organizations using Atlassian's Model Context Protocol (MCP), exploiting AI-powered workflows in JSM. Malicious support tickets can be used to gain privileged access and exfiltrate sensitive data without breaching internal systems.

item.title: No, the 16 billion credentials leak is not a new data breach
item.description: This article reports on a massive compilation of previously stolen credentials, allegedly obtained through infostealers, data breaches, and credential-stuffing attacks. The compilation was briefly exposed online, containing over 64,000 credential pairs. The article warns users to adopt good cybersecurity habits, use unique and strong passwords, enable two-factor authentication (2FA), and monitor for known breaches using services like Have I Been Pwned.

item.title: Godfather Android malware now uses virtualization to hijack banking apps
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Godfather Android Malware; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Godfather Android malware creates isolated virtual environments on mobile devices to steal account data and transactions from legitimate banking apps, using tactics such as intent spoofing, StubActivity, and API hooking. The malware displays a fake lock screen overlay to trick users into entering their PIN/passwords and can record account credentials, passwords, PINs, touch events, and capture responses from the banking backend.

item.title: Over 100,000 WordPress Sites Exposed to Privilege Escalation via MCP AI Engine
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Jordy Meow AI Engine; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5071; Summary: The AI Engine plugin has a severe vulnerability allowing authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access or higher to gain full control over the Model Context Protocol (MCP) module, enabling privilege escalation and potentially complete site compromise.

item.title: North Korean Hackers Deploy Malware Using Weaponized Calendly and Google Meet Links
item.description: TA444, a North Korean state-sponsored threat actor group, has launched a sophisticated malware campaign targeting cryptocurrency foundations. The attack leverages weaponized Calendly links, deceptive Google Meet invitations, and deepfakes to deliver malicious payloads designed for macOS systems.

item.title: Silver Fox APT Uses Weaponized Medical Software to Deploy Remote Access Tools and Disable AV
item.description: The article discusses the China-based advanced persistent threat (APT) group Silver Fox's multi-stage campaign targeting healthcare delivery organizations (HDOs) and public sector entities. The campaign uses trojanized medical software, cloud infrastructure, and a custom remote access trojan (RAT) to deploy cyber espionage and data theft operations.

item.title: Gamers Targeted! Fake Minecraft Mods Enable Attackers to Take Control of Your System
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Minecraft; CVE(s): None; Summary: A malicious campaign targeting Minecraft users has been discovered, using a Distribution as a Service (DaaS) platform to distribute malware disguised as legitimate mods. The malware initiates a multi-stage attack chain designed to steal sensitive data and compromise systems, exploiting the trust of gamers seeking to enhance their gaming experience.

item.title: New Android Malware Surge Hits Devices via Overlays, Virtualization Fraud and NFC Theft
item.description: AntiDot is a financially motivated Android malware sold as a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) on underground forums, compromising over 3,775 devices across 273 unique campaigns. It features capabilities to record device screens, intercept SMS messages, extract sensitive data, conduct overlay attacks, and remotely control infected devices.

item.title: Webinar: Stolen credentials are the new front door to your network
item.description: Credential-based attacks are becoming increasingly common, with threat actors using stolen credentials to breach networks. Infostealer malware campaigns have exploded in recent years, stealing billions of credentials and feeding a booming cybercrime marketplace. The webinar will explore how attackers are shifting from exploiting vulnerabilities to simply logging in using large-scale credential abuse.

item.title: ZDI-25-409: RARLAB WinRAR Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: RARLAB WinRAR; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6218; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of RARLAB WinRAR, requiring user interaction. The specific flaw exists in the handling of file paths within archive files, allowing an attacker to traverse to unintended directories and execute code in the context of the current user.

item.title: ZDI-25-410: Allegra calculateTokenExpDate Password Recovery Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Allegra; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6216; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of Allegra, with no required user interaction. The issue stems from a predictable value used in generating a password reset token within the application's password recovery mechanism, allowing attackers to exploit it and bypass authentication.

item.title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman discusses GPT-5 release date
item.description: This article does not discuss a vulnerability. It appears to be an update about OpenAI's next big upgrade to ChatGPT, including the potential release of GPT-5 and improvements to the Operator Agent.

item.title: Israel-tied Predatory Sparrow hackers are waging cyberwar on Iran’s financial system
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; Summary: Predatory Sparrow, a group believed to be linked to Israel's military or intelligence agencies, has been carrying out cyberattacks against Iran's critical infrastructure, including railways and gas stations. The group's recent attack on the Khouzestan steel mill caused significant physical damage. It is unclear why they have turned their attention to Iran's financial sector, but experts warn that this development may lead to more serious consequences.

item.title: US recovers $225 million of crypto stolen in investment scams
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice has seized over $225 million in cryptocurrency linked to investment fraud and money laundering operations, the largest crypto seizure in the history of the U.S. Secret Service. The funds were traced using blockchain analysis and were laundered through a complex network of cryptocurrency addresses to obscure their origin.

item.title: Special Webinar: Key Insights from Verizon’s 2025 DBIR
item.description: The article discusses the Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) 2025, which highlights critical trends in cybersecurity, including rising GenAI-related risks, credential theft, and vulnerabilities from third-party partners. It also emphasizes the need for enterprises to adopt an updated, integrated approach to cybersecurity and provides insights on how to strengthen security posture.

item.title: Microsoft unveils new security defaults for Windows 365 Cloud PCs
item.description: Microsoft has announced new security defaults for Windows 365 Cloud PCs, including disabling clipboard, drive, USB, and printer redirections by default to reduce risks of data theft and block malware attacks. Additionally, the company will start blocking access to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Office files via legacy authentication protocols in July.

item.title: jQuery Migrate Library Compromised to Steal Logins via Parrot Traffic Direction System
item.description: Vulnerable Product: jQuery Migrate; CVE(s): None; Summary: A weaponized version of the jQuery Migrate library was used in a sophisticated malware campaign that exploited the trust in the library. The attack delivered a malicious script through a compromised Middle Eastern business website, which stole sensitive data, logged keystrokes, and deployed additional threats such as cryptocurrency miners or click-fraud scripts.

item.title: ChatGPT will analyze Gmail emails, manage schedule on Google Calendar
item.description: This article does not discuss a vulnerability, but rather mentions the testing of integration features between ChatGPT and Gmail/Google Calendar. The feature will allow users to summarize emails and create events, and may be tied to the ChatGPT Search feature.

item.title: Hackers Deploy Amatera Stealer Using Advanced Web Injection and Anti-Analysis Techniques
item.description: Amatera Stealer is a rebranded information stealer malware that exhibits advanced features and stealth mechanisms. It is distributed through web injection campaigns, software cracks, and fake downloads, and can steal sensitive data from browsers, cryptocurrency wallets, email clients, and messaging apps.

item.title: Krispy Kreme Data Breach Exposes Customer Personal Information
item.description: A ransomware attack on Krispy Kreme Doughnut Corporation's information technology systems exposed the personal information of over 160,000 individuals. The attackers claimed to have stolen 184 GB of sensitive data, including personal and financial information, client documents, payroll, and accounting records.

item.title: Android Spyware SpyNote Masquerading as Google Translate Found in Open Directories
item.description: The article discusses the discovery of multiple SpyNote spyware samples in open directories across the internet, which can be disguised as legitimate Android applications. These malware files harvest sensitive data from unsuspecting users by exploiting accessibility services and device administrator privileges.

item.title: Hackers Use VBScript Files to Deploy Masslogger Credential Stealer Malware
item.description: The article discusses a sophisticated variant of the Masslogger credential stealer malware that spreads through VBScript Encoded (.VBE) files. It uses evasive techniques such as fileless malware, heavy registry exploitation, and multi-stage execution to evade detection by traditional antivirus and signature-based methods.

item.title: DuckDuckGo beefs up scam defense to block fake stores, crypto sites
item.description: DuckDuckGo's Scam Blocker tool has been updated to protect against a broader range of online scams, including fake e-commerce, cryptocurrency exchanges, and "scareware" sites. The tool blocks known malware distribution and phishing URLs by default, and users can opt-in for additional protection across other internet apps when using the DuckDuckGo VPN.

item.title: Telecom giant Viasat breached by China's Salt Typhoon hackers
item.description: The article reports that satellite communications company Viasat has been breached by China's Salt Typhoon state hackers. The breach occurred earlier this year and was discovered when a compromised device was found to have unauthorized access. Viasat claims the incident has been remediated and no customer impact was detected.

item.title: Viasat Targeted in Cyberattack by Salt Typhoon APT Group
item.description: A Chinese state-sponsored group known as Salt Typhoon has been linked to a sweeping cyberespionage campaign that compromised major telecommunications firms, including Viasat Inc., Verizon, AT&T, and Lumen Technologies. The campaign targeted phone records, including those of then-presidential candidate Donald Trump and members of both major campaigns, and highlights the growing threat posed by advanced persistent threat (APT) actors targeting critical American infrastructure.

item.title: BlueNoroff Deepfake Zoom Scam Hits Crypto Employee with MacOS Backdoor Malware
item.description: BlueNoroff threat actor targets employee with deepfaked company executives in deceptive Zoom calls to trick them into installing malware on their Apple macOS devices. The attack involves the use of Calendly link, fake Zoom domain, and AppleScript that downloads next-stage payload and executes shell script, ultimately leading to the installation of eight distinct malicious binaries.

item.title: Golden SAML Attack: How Attackers Gain Control of Federation Server’s Private Key
item.description: The Golden SAML attack is a sophisticated threat that exploits the trust mechanisms of Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) authentication to compromise every account within an organization by forging authentic-looking tokens. This attack targets the private key of federation servers, allowing attackers to impersonate any user and bypass security controls with stealth and precision.

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Rises as Major Threat, Demanding $50M in Ransom
item.description: The Qilin ransomware group has surged to the forefront of digital extortion, demanding ransoms as high as $50 million and disrupting critical services worldwide. With a robust Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platform, recruiting affiliates through Russian-language forums, and offering lucrative revenue shares, Qilin has amassed over $50 million in ransom payments in 2024 alone.

item.title: Secure Vibe Coding: The Complete New Guide
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Vibe Coding; CVE(s): None; Summary: Vibe coding, the use of natural language to generate software with AI, introduces "silent killer" vulnerabilities that evade traditional security tools. These exploitable flaws are created when AI generates code without explicit prompting for security features, leading to insecure patterns and functions that can be exploited in production environments.

item.title: Threat Actor Exploit GitHub and Hosted 60 GitHub Repositories with 100s of Malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GitHub; CVE(s): None; Summary: Banana Squad exploited GitHub by hosting over 60 malicious repositories containing hundreds of trojanized Python files. The repositories used advanced evasion techniques to hide harmful content, making it nearly undetectable to casual inspection. All 67 repositories have been removed by GitHub, but the potential impact remains unclear.

item.title: Sophisticated Phishing Attack Uses ASP Pages to Target Prominent Russia Critics – Google
item.description: A Russia state-sponsored cyber threat actor, tracked as UNC6293, has been identified by Google Threat Intelligence Group (GTIG) in a sophisticated phishing campaign targeting academics and critics of Russia. The campaign used advanced social engineering tactics to trick victims into creating and sharing Application Specific Passwords (ASPs), which granted persistent access to Gmail accounts.

item.title: ClamAV 1.4.3 and 1.0.9 Released with Fixes for Critical Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ClamAV; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20260, CVE-2025-20234; Summary: The ClamAV development team has released two security patch releases, versions 1.4.3 and 1.0.9, to address significant vulnerabilities in the PDF file parser and UDF file parser. The flaws, identified as CVE-2025-20260 and CVE-2025-20234, have the potential to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition or enable remote code execution.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Cloudflare Tunnels to Infect Windows Systems With Python Malware
item.description: A sophisticated malware campaign dubbed SERPENTINE#CLOUD has emerged, using Cloudflare Tunnel infrastructure to deliver Python-based malware to Windows systems across Western nations. The campaign exploits trusted cloud services to bypass network defenses and maintain anonymity, featuring a complex, multi-stage infection chain designed for stealth and persistence.

item.title: Uncover LOTS Attacks Hiding in Trusted Tools — Learn How in This Free Expert Session
item.description: The article discusses a tactic called "Living Off Trusted Sites" (LOTS), where attackers blend in with legitimate traffic by hiding malicious code inside routine traffic on well-known platforms like Google, Microsoft, Dropbox, and Slack. LOTS tactics exploit common business tools, shortened URLs, and trusted cloud services to host malicious payloads, making it difficult for traditional defenses to detect them.

item.title: Krispy Kreme says November data breach impacts over 160,000 people
item.description:
FYSA:
The article discusses a cyberattack on Krispy Kreme that resulted in the theft of personal information of over 160,000 individuals. The attackers, identified as the Play ransomware gang, claimed to have stolen sensitive data from the company's network and threatened to leak it online unless a ransom was paid. The breach was detected by Krispy Kreme on November 29 and notified affected individuals in May 2025.

item.title: Microsoft Entra ID Adds Passkey (FIDO2) Support in Public Preview
item.description: Microsoft has announced an update to its identity platform, Microsoft Entra ID, which introduces expanded passkey (FIDO2) support. This update allows IT administrators to configure passkey authentication policies at a granular level, enabling organizations to tailor authentication methods for different user groups. The rollout is set to occur globally from mid-October to mid-November 2025 and will simplify the authentication process by unifying credentials from hardware keys, computers, and mobile devices.

item.title: How CVE-2025-6018 and CVE-2025-6019 Enable Full Root Access on Linux
item.description: Vulnerable Product: openSUSE Leap 15, SUSE Linux Enterprise 15; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6018, CVE-2025-6019; Summary: Two newly discovered Local Privilege Escalation (LPE) vulnerabilities in Linux distributions allow attackers to chain low-level access into full root control. The first vulnerability manipulates environment variables during login, allowing remote attackers to impersonate local users and gain permission to perform actions reserved for physical users. The second vulnerability abuses XFS file system resizing to gain root access using the udisk daemon.

item.title: LogMeIn Remote Access Abused in Targeted System Compromise
item.description: This article describes a sophisticated cyberattack campaign that leverages LogMeIn Resolve remote access software to gain unauthorized control over user systems. The attack begins with a convincingly crafted invoice-themed spam email, designed to trick recipients into opening a malicious PDF attachment, which installs the remote access tool and grants attackers full remote access to the compromised system.

item.title: Jitter-Trap: New Method Uncovers Stealthy Beacon Communications
item.description: The article introduces Jitter-Trap, a detection technique that uses behavioral and network analysis to identify post-exploitation and command-and-control (C2) communication in cyberattacks. It leverages the randomness used by attackers to evade detection, turning it into a powerful detection tool.

item.title: Russian APT29 Exploits Gmail App Passwords to Bypass 2FA in Targeted Phishing Campaign
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google account feature - Application Specific Passwords (ASPs); CVE(s): None; Summary: Threat actors with suspected ties to Russia are using a novel social engineering tactic that takes advantage of Google's application specific passwords (ASPs) to gain access to victims' email accounts. The tactic involves building rapport with targets, sending benign phishing emails disguised as meeting invitations, and tricking them into sharing the ASP passcode.

item.title: CVE-2025-3248 in Langflow Exploited to Deploy Flodrix Botnet
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Langflow; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3248; Summary: A critical Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in Langflow's /api/v1/validate/code endpoint allows unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code directly on the server, granting remote control over the host. The vulnerability impacts Langflow versions prior to 1.3.0 and is particularly dangerous due to Langflow's popularity in cloud-hosted AI deployments.

item.title: Cisco AnyConnect VPN Flaw Allows Attackers to Launch DoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Meraki; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20271; Summary: The vulnerability stems from a variable initialization error that occurs when establishing SSL VPN sessions using client certificate authentication. Attackers can exploit this flaw by sending specially crafted HTTPS requests to affected devices, causing the Cisco AnyConnect VPN service to crash and restart, immediately disconnecting all active VPN users and forcing them to re-authenticate.

item.title: Ransomware Gang Busted by Authorities; Devices and Evidence Seized
item.description: Thai authorities dismantled a sophisticated criminal enterprise operating from the Antai Holiday Hotel in Pattaya, discovering a high-stakes gambling den and a ransomware cybercrime ring. The operation highlights the growing trend of cybercrime being intertwined with traditional organized crime, including gambling, money laundering, and identity theft.

item.title: Apache Traffic Server Vulnerability Allows DoS Attacks Through Memory Exhaustion
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache Software Foundation Apache Traffic Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49763; Summary: Attackers can exploit a flaw in the Edge Side Includes (ESI) plugin to trigger denial-of-service (DoS) attacks by exhausting server memory, affecting multiple versions of ATS 9.0.0 to 9.2.101 and 10.0.0 to 10.0.5.

item.title: Ryuk ransomware’s initial access expert extradited to the U.S.
item.description: A member of the Ryuk ransomware operation, who specialized in gaining initial access to corporate networks, has been extradited to the United States. The individual was arrested in April 2025 and is suspected of earning $150 million while active between 2018 and 2020.

item.title: Meta Adds Passkey Login Support to Facebook for Android and iOS Users
item.description: Meta Platforms is adding support for passkeys on Facebook, allowing users to securely sign in with biometrics or device lock PIN code. This passwordless authentication solution is resistant to guessing or theft by malicious websites and effective against phishing and password spraying attacks.

item.title: Open Next SSRF Flaw in Cloudflare Lets Hackers Fetch Data from Any Host
item.description: Vulnerable Product: @opennextjs/cloudflare; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6087; Summary: The @opennextjs/cloudflare package contains a critical Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability that allows unauthenticated attackers to proxy arbitrary remote content through the vulnerable site's domain, posing risks of phishing, data exposure, and domain abuse.

item.title: Password Reset Link Poisoning Leads to Full Account Takeover
item.description: A critical vulnerability known as Password Reset Link Poisoning enables attackers to manipulate the domain in password reset links, redirecting users to malicious sites and capturing sensitive reset tokens. This allows for full account takeover, exposing web users and organizations to serious risks such as account takeover, phishing, and reputational damage.

item.title: New Linux Flaws Enable Full Root Access via PAM and Udisks Across Major Distributions
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Qualys PAM and libblockdev; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6018, CVE-2025-6019; Summary: Two local privilege escalation (LPE) flaws were discovered by Qualys that can be exploited to gain root privileges on machines running major Linux distributions. CVE-2025-6018 allows an unprivileged user to elevate to the "allow_active" user and call Polkit actions, while CVE-2025-6019 enables an "allow_active" user to gain full root privileges by chaining it with CVE-2025-6018.

item.title: Pro-Israel hackers hit Iran's Nobitex exchange, burn $90M in crypto
item.description: The "Predatory Sparrow" hacking group claims to have stolen over $90 million in cryptocurrency from Nobitex, Iran's largest crypto exchange, and intentionally burnt the funds by sending them to vanity addresses. The attack is believed to be politically motivated, with ties to the IRGC and Iranian leadership.

item.title: Address bar shows hp.com. Browser displays scammers’ malicious text anyway.
item.description: The article discusses a scam that injects fake phone numbers into official websites through Google ads. Scammers buy ads with appended parameters that are not displayed in the ad itself, making it difficult for users to suspect anything is amiss. The injected phone number appears legitimate and can trick users into revealing personal or financial information.

item.title: North Korean hackers deepfake execs in Zoom call to spread Mac malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: BlueNoroff; CVE(s): None; Summary: The North Korean BlueNoroff hacking group is using deepfakes to trick employees into installing custom malware on their macOS devices. The attack involves a fake Zoom meeting and the installation of an AppleScript file that downloads a secondary payload, which includes malicious binaries such as Telegram 2, Root Troy V4, a (InjectWithDyld), XScreen (keyboardd), and CryptoBot (airmond).

item.title: ZDI-25-408: PEAK-System Driver PCANFD_ADD_FILTERS Time-Of-Check Time-Of-Use Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PEAK-System Driver PCANFD_ADD_FILTERS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6217; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of PEAK-System Driver. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, which is due to a lack of proper locking when performing operations on an object.

item.title: Chollima Hackers Target Windows and MacOS with New GolangGhost RAT Malware
item.description: The Famous Chollima group has launched a sophisticated remote access trojan (RAT) campaign targeting Windows and MacOS devices, with a focus on professionals in cryptocurrency and blockchain technologies. The attackers use a two-pronged strategy, creating fake job interview platforms to lure victims into executing malicious commands that download and launch the PylangGhost or GolangGhost variants.

item.title: AI Revolutionizes PLA Military Intelligence with Rapid Deployment Across Operations
item.description: The People's Liberation Army (PLA) of China is adopting generative artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance its military operations, using advanced large language models (LLMs) for data processing, intelligence analysis, and decision-making support. This integration poses risks such as hallucination issues, ideological bias, and counterintelligence concerns, highlighting the need for rigorous experimentation and outcome assessment to ensure effective application of AI tools.

item.title: Russia’s Digital Arsenal: The Strategic Use of Private Companies and Hacktivists in Cyber Operations
item.description: Russia's sophisticated cyber warfare strategy emerges as a calculated blend of state power and non-state agility, leveraging private companies, hacktivists, and criminal proxies to amplify its digital dominance. The strategy involves concentric rings with state agencies at the core and a diverse array of non-state actors, including private IT firms, hacktivist groups, and eCrime collectives, which offers Moscow cost efficiency, flexibility, and access to cutting-edge skills, but also risks unpredictability and blurs the line between state and non-state action.

item.title: A week with a "smart" car
item.description:
The article discusses the author's experience with advanced vehicle systems in a new car, highlighting issues with constant alerts and difficulty disabling features. It also touches on the importance of user experience and frictionless security tools.
FYSA: Cisco Talos has discovered that the North Korean-aligned threat actor Famous Chollima is targeting cryptocurrency and blockchain professionals through sophisticated phishing campaigns using Python-based malware (PylangGhost) and Golang-based variants. The campaign highlights the constant evolution of threat actors' tools, emphasizing the need for robust defenses and user education.
FYSA: AI scraping bots are breaking into libraries, archives, museums, and galleries, causing some collections to go offline. Additionally, a cybercriminal group leaked 7.4 million citizen records in Paraguay on the dark web, demanding $7.4 million.

item.title: Halo Security Honored with 2025 MSP Today Product of the Year Award
item.description: Halo Security's Attack Surface Management Platform has been named a 2025 MSP Today Product of the Year Award winner for its innovation, performance, and measurable impact on customers and partners alike. The platform enables organizations to discover, monitor, and secure their internet-facing assets, combining attacker-like discovery methods with ongoing security monitoring and vulnerability scanning.

item.title: Beware: Fake CAPTCHA Windows Stealthily Install LightPerlGirl Malware
item.description: A newly identified malware strain, LightPerlGirl, uses deceptive fake CAPTCHA popups to infiltrate systems. It propagates through a social engineering tactic called the ClickFix attack, bypassing traditional security measures and exploiting user interaction. The attack begins with a compromised legitimate website serving malicious JavaScript, which triggers a fake CAPTCHA popup, tricking users into executing an obfuscated PowerShell command.

item.title: New Malware Campaign Uses Cloudflare Tunnels to Deliver RATs via Phishing Chains
item.description:
The article describes a new campaign using Cloudflare Tunnel subdomains to host malicious payloads and deliver them via phishing emails. The attack starts with sending payment-themed emails bearing a link to a zipped document containing a Windows shortcut file, which activates the infection sequence. The payload is executed in memory, allowing for evasion of detection.
FYSA: None

item.title: Microsoft 365 to block file access via legacy auth protocols by default
item.description: This article does not mention a specific vulnerability. Instead, it discusses Microsoft's announcement to update security defaults for all Microsoft 365 tenants to block access to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Office files via legacy authentication protocols.

item.title: 'Stargazers' use fake Minecraft mods to steal player passwords
item.description:
A large-scale malware campaign targets Minecraft players by distributing malicious mods and cheats that infect Windows devices with info-stealers. The campaign uses GitHub as a distribution platform, disguising the malware as legitimate Minecraft content, and can steal credentials, authentication tokens, and cryptocurrency wallets.
Note: There is no specific vulnerability mentioned in this article, but rather a malicious campaign using social engineering tactics to spread malware to victims' devices.

item.title: 1,500+ Minecraft Players Infected by Java Malware Masquerading as Game Mods on GitHub
item.description:
The article describes a multi-stage malware campaign targeting Minecraft users, which employs a Java-based malware using a distribution-as-service (DaaS) offering called Stargazers Ghost Network. The campaign's end goal is to trick players into downloading a Minecraft mod from GitHub and deliver a .NET information stealer with comprehensive data theft capabilities.
FYSA: The article highlights the use of an illicit offering, the Stargazers Ghost Network, which makes use of thousands of GitHub accounts to set up tainted repositories that masquerade as cracked software and game cheats.

item.title: ChainLink Phishing: How Trusted Domains Become Threat Vectors
item.description: The article discusses the evolution of phishing attacks, specifically "ChainLink Phishing", which uses trusted infrastructure to funnel victims through a series of credible-looking prompts before harvesting credentials. It highlights how traditional defenses are insufficient against these attacks and emphasizes the need for real-time analysis of web pages and user interactions to effectively mitigate threats like zero-hour phishing.

item.title: CISA warns of attackers exploiting Linux flaw with PoC exploit
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Linux kernel's OverlayFS subsystem; CVE(s): CVE-2023-0386; Summary: A high-severity vulnerability (CVE-2023-0386) in the Linux kernel's OverlayFS subsystem allows attackers to gain root privileges. The flaw, caused by improper ownership management, was patched in January 2023 and publicly disclosed two months later. Multiple proof-of-concept exploits were shared on GitHub, making exploitation attempts easier.

item.title: Healthcare SaaS firm says data breach impacts 5.4 million patients
item.description: Episource, a healthcare services company, has reported a data breach that affected over 5 million people in the United States. The breach occurred between January 27 and February 6, 2025, when hackers accessed and exfiltrated sensitive health information, including full names, physical addresses, medical records, and social security numbers.

item.title: SuperCard Malware Hijacks Android Devices to Steal Payment Card Data and Relay it to Attackers
item.description: The article discusses the emergence of SuperCard, a malicious modification of the legitimate NFCGate program, which exploits Near Field Communication (NFC) traffic to intercept sensitive bank card data. The malware is distributed via a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) platform named SuperCard X and targets Android users globally, with recent attacks recorded in Russia.

item.title: Zyxel NWA50AX Pro Hit by N-Day Flaw Allowing Arbitrary File Deletion
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Zyxel NWA50AX Pro; CVE(s): CVE-2024-29974; Summary: The Zyxel NWA50AX Pro WiFi 6 access point contains an arbitrary file deletion vulnerability (CVE-2024-29974) that allows attackers to delete files without authentication by crafting a POST request with manipulated parameters. This can lead to further attacks, such as replacing configuration or password files, potentially causing privilege escalation or denial of service.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Transit Mode in Apple Pay and GPay to Steal Money
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mobile Wallets (Apple Pay, Google Pay); CVE(s): None; Summary: The Express Transit mode in mobile wallets like Apple Pay and Google Pay allows for automatic charges without biometric checks or alerts, making it vulnerable to exploitation by hackers who can drain funds instantly and silently. Attackers can grab unlocked phones, mimic legitimate behavior, and exploit weak PINs to steal money.

item.title: Microsoft Enhances Office 365 Defender to Stop Email Bombing Campaigns
item.description: The article discusses a new feature called Mail Bombing Detection in Microsoft Office 365 Defender, designed to combat email bombing attacks by automatically identifying and blocking massive volumes of emails. This feature is enabled by default and does not require manual configuration, providing enhanced protection against email-based threats without additional administrative overhead.

item.title: MITRE and Splunk Expose Critical Vulnerabilities in Open Source GitHub Actions
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GitHub Actions; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47928; Summary: The GitHub Actions workflows of several high-profile open source projects were found to be vulnerable due to the misuse of the pull_request_target trigger. This vulnerability allows attackers to access sensitive secrets and high-privilege tokens, potentially leading to full repository takeovers. The vulnerability was exploited in projects like spotipy-dev/spotipy and MITRE's Cyber Analytics Repository (CAR).

item.title: RapperBot Botnet Surges with 50,000+ Attacks Targeting Network Edge Devices
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: The RapperBot botnet has resurfaced with over 50,000 attacks targeting network edge devices, exploiting vulnerabilities in IoT devices such as routers, IP cameras, and other connected hardware. The botnet uses brute-force techniques and exploits known vulnerabilities to compromise devices, establishing persistence by downloading additional payloads and conducting DDoS attacks or serving as a gateway for further malicious activities.

item.title: DMV-Style Phishing Scams Target U.S. Citizens to Harvest Sensitive Information
item.description: A highly coordinated phishing campaign targeting U.S. citizens has been discovered, utilizing SMS phishing (smishing) and impersonating state Departments of Motor Vehicles (DMVs). The attack threatened license suspension or legal action and attempted to steal personal information by directing victims to fake DMV websites. The campaign is attributed to a China-based threat actor.

item.title: VMware Unveils Cloud Foundation 9.0 With AI and Next-Gen Workloads
item.description: VMware has announced the general availability of VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF) 9.0, a private cloud technology designed to meet the demands of AI, data-intensive workloads, and modern enterprise operations. The new release offers a unified platform that merges the speed and flexibility of cloud with the performance, governance, and cost control required for on-premises environments.

item.title: FedRAMP at Startup Speed: Lessons Learned
item.description: None

item.title: Google Chrome Vulnerabilities Enable Arbitrary Code Execution – Update Now!
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google Chrome; CVE(s): None; Summary: The update addresses three high-severity vulnerabilities, including an integer overflow in V8 and a use-after-free in Profiler, which could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code, potentially leading to data theft or system compromise. If exploited, these vulnerabilities could enable attackers to bypass security controls and take control of a user's system.

item.title: Water Curse Hijacks 76 GitHub Accounts to Deliver Multi-Stage Malware Campaign
item.description: Water Curse is a financially motivated threat actor that uses weaponized GitHub repositories to deliver multi-stage malware, enabling data exfiltration, remote access, and long-term persistence on infected systems. The actor's arsenal includes various tools and programming languages, and they employ anti-debugging techniques, privilege escalation methods, and persistence mechanisms to maintain a foothold on affected hosts.

item.title: BlackHat AI Tool WormGPT Enhanced with Grok and Mixtral
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WormGPT; CVE(s): None; Summary: WormGPT is a notorious blackhat AI tool that has resurfaced in enhanced forms powered by advanced language models such as xAI's Grok and Mistral AI's Mixtral. The tool allows for the generation of human-like text, enabling malicious activities, and its variants have been introduced on underground forums.

item.title: BeyondTrust warns of pre-auth RCE in Remote Support software
item.description: Vulnerable Product: BeyondTrust Remote Support (RS) and Privileged Remote Access (PRA) solutions; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5309; Summary: A high-severity Server-Side Template Injection vulnerability in the chat feature of BeyondTrust RS/PRA allows unauthenticated attackers to gain remote code execution on vulnerable servers. Exploitation does not require authentication, and administrators can mitigate the risk by enabling SAML authentication and enforcing session keys.

item.title: ZDI-25-402: Fuji Electric Smart Editor TL5 File Parsing Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fuji Electric Smart Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41388; Summary: The Fuji Electric Smart Editor TL5 file parsing vulnerability is a stack-based buffer overflow that allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code, requiring user interaction. This occurs due to the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data length prior to copying it to a fixed-length buffer.

item.title: When legitimate tools go rogue
item.description: The article discusses the trend of attackers using legitimate software, such as system tools (e.g., whoami, nltest, and nslookup) and remote monitoring and management (RMM) tools (e.g., ScreenConnect or AnyDesk), to carry out malicious actions. This tactic is referred to as "living off the land binaries" (LOLBins). The article highlights the importance of asset management, behavioral baselining, continuous monitoring, and threat intel alignment in detecting these types of attacks.

item.title: ZDI-25-403: Fuji Electric Smart Editor V8 File Parsing Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fuji Electric Smart Editor V8; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41388; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Fuji Electric Smart Editor. User interaction is required, and the issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-404: Fuji Electric Smart Editor X1 File Parsing Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fuji Electric Smart Editor X1; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41388; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Fuji Electric Smart Editor. User interaction is required, and the issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-405: Fuji Electric Smart Editor X1 File Parsing Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fuji Electric Smart Editor X1; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41388; Summary: The Fuji Electric Smart Editor X1 has a file parsing stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the issue results from improper validation of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-406: SolarWinds Serv-U FTP Service Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SolarWinds Serv-U; CVE(s): CVE-2024-45711; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of SolarWinds Serv-U. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, and it occurs due to the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations.

item.title: ZDI-25-407: SolarWinds Web Help Desk AjaxProxy Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SolarWinds Web Help Desk; CVE(s): CVE-2024-28988; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of SolarWinds Web Help Desk without authentication. The specific flaw exists within the AjaxProxy due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in deserialization of untrusted data.

item.title: Famous Chollima deploying Python version of GolangGhost RAT
item.description: The article discusses a Python-based remote access trojan (RAT) called "PylangGhost" used by a North Korean-aligned threat actor, Famous Chollima. The RAT targets employees with experience in cryptocurrency and blockchain technologies and is designed to steal browser credentials and session cookies from over 80 extensions, including password managers and cryptocurrency wallets.

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Emerges as a Major Threat Targeting Windows, Linux, and ESXi Systems
item.description: Qilin ransomware has emerged as a significant threat, leveraging a sophisticated Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) model and advanced technical capabilities to target Windows, Linux, and ESXi systems. Its features include custom-built malware, configurable encryption modes, and services like data storage, spam tools, and legal assistance, positioning it as a comprehensive cybercrime ecosystem.

item.title: Cybercriminals Leverage ClickFix Strategy to Deploy RATs and Data-Stealing Malware
item.description: Cybercriminals are exploiting a social engineering technique called ClickFix to initiate multi-stage cyberattacks, delivering remote access trojans (RATs) and data-stealing malware with alarming efficiency. The technique manipulates users into executing malicious PowerShell commands by disguising them as routine prompts like CAPTCHA verifications or browser updates.

item.title: Critical Privilege Escalation Flaws Grant Full Root Access on Multiple Linux Distros
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SUSE 15, openSUSE Leap 15; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6018, CVE-2025-6019; Summary: Two interconnected local privilege escalation (LPE) vulnerabilities enable attackers to gain full root access on a wide range of Linux distributions with minimal effort. The flaws impact both desktop and server installations, requiring only a local user session such as SSH for exploitation.

item.title: New Winos 4.0 Malware Strain Emerges as Major Threat to Windows Systems
item.description: FortiGuard Labs has uncovered a new strain of malware, dubbed Winos 4.0, targeting Microsoft Windows users with a focus on individuals in Taiwan, utilizing phishing tactics and masquerading as government or business entities; the malware is designed to steal sensitive user data and maintain persistence through registry keys.

item.title: New Linux udisks flaw lets attackers get root on major Linux distros
item.description: Vulnerable Product: openSUSE Leap 15, SUSE Linux Enterprise 15, Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6018, CVE-2025-6019; Summary: Two local privilege escalation (LPE) vulnerabilities were discovered in the Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM) framework and libblockdev. Exploiting these flaws allows attackers to gain root privileges on systems running major Linux distributions, enabling agent tampering, persistence, and lateral movement.

item.title: Hackers Claim Breach of Scania Financial Services, Leak Sensitive Data
item.description: A threat actor claiming to be "hensi" infiltrated the subdomain insurance.scania.com of Scania Financial Services, exfiltrating sensitive files containing personal, financial, and potentially medical data. The breach is believed to have occurred when attackers exploited credentials belonging to an external IT partner using infostealer malware.

item.title: Asana warns MCP AI feature exposed customer data to other orgs
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Asana; CVE(s): None; Summary: A logic flaw in the Model Context Protocol (MCP) feature of Asana's work management platform potentially exposed data from one organization to another, including task-level information and project metadata. The exposure occurred for over a month before being discovered on June 4 and has impacted around 1,000 customers.

item.title: CVE-2025-23121: Critical RCE Vulnerability Patched in Veeam Backup & Replication
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Veeam Backup & Replication; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23121 (CVSS 9.9), CVE-2025-24286 (CVSS 7.2), CVE-2025-24287 (CVSS 6.1); Summary: A critical Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability (CVE-2025-23121) allows authenticated domain users to remotely execute arbitrary code on Veeam Backup Servers, affecting systems that are domain-joined. Additionally, two other vulnerabilities were discovered, one allowing modification of backup jobs and another allowing local system users to modify directory contents.

item.title: CISA Alerts to Active Exploits of Linux Kernel Improper Ownership Management Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various Linux distributions; CVE(s): CVE-2023-0386; Summary: A critical Linux kernel vulnerability (CVE-2023-0386) allows local users to escalate privileges and potentially gain root-level access. The flaw emerges when a user copies a file with special capabilities from a nosuid mount into another mount, due to the kernel's failure to properly clear setuid and setgid bits during the copy-up operation.

item.title: Ex-CIA Analyst Sentenced to 37 Months for Leaking Top Secret National Defense Documents
item.description: A former CIA analyst, Asif William Rahman, was sentenced to 37 months in prison for stealing and transmitting classified National Defense Information (NDI) without authorization. He retained multiple Secret and Top Secret documents on October 17, 2024, and wilfully sent them to individuals who did not have the necessary clearance.

item.title: CISA Warns of Active Exploitation of Linux Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Linux kernel; CVE(s): CVE-2023-0386; Summary: The Linux kernel contains an improper ownership management vulnerability (CVE-2023-0386) that can be exploited to escalate privileges on susceptible systems. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 7.8, allows a local user to create SUID binaries owned by root and execute them, potentially leading to privilege escalation.

item.title: Google’s Gerrit Platform Flaw Exposes 18 Google Projects, Including ChromiumOS, to Hackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google Gerrit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-1568; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Google's Gerrit code-collaboration platform allows unauthorized code submissions by hackers, putting at least 18 major Google projects at risk. The flaw centers on misconfigured permissions and logic flaws in the review process, enabling attackers to inject malicious code without detection.

item.title: Veeam Patches CVE-2025-23121: Critical RCE Bug Rated 9.9 CVSS in Backup & Replication
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Veeam; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23121, CVE-2025-24286, CVE-2025-24287; Summary: A critical security flaw (CVE-2025-23121) in Veeam's Backup & Replication software allows remote code execution under certain conditions. Another flaw (CVE-2025-24286) permits an authenticated user to modify backup jobs and execute arbitrary code, while a third vulnerability (CVE-2025-24287) enables local system users to modify directory contents and execute code with elevated permissions.

item.title: Iran Slows Internet to Prevent Cyber Attacks Amid Escalating Regional Conflict
item.description: Iranian government has throttled internet access in the country, allegedly to prevent Israel's covert cyber operations. This development is part of an escalating digital conflict between Iran and Israel, with both sides engaging in retaliatory cyber attacks. The conflict also involves threat actors affiliated with Iran, who have launched malicious activities against U.S. critical infrastructure using IOCONTROL malware.

item.title: Veeam Vulnerabilities Expose Backup Servers to Remote Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Veeam; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23121, CVE-2025-24286, CVE-2025-24287; Summary: A critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-23121) allows remote code execution on a Veeam Backup Server, while two other vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-24286 and CVE-2025-24287) enable privilege escalation and local privilege escalation in the Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows, respectively.

item.title: Citrix NetScaler ADC & Gateway Flaws Expose Sensitive Data to Hackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5349, CVE-2025-5777; Summary: Two critical vulnerabilities have been discovered in Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway, allowing attackers to gain unauthorized access to critical management functions or read sensitive memory contents. The flaws can be exploited remotely and put enterprise networks at significant risk of data leakage.

item.title: Threats to the 2025 NATO Summit
item.description:
FYSA:
The provided article appears to be a cybersecurity threat analysis report focused on Russian hybrid warfare tactics and potential threats to European critical infrastructure ahead of the 2025 NATO Summit. The report highlights various forms of sabotage, vandalism, and coercive military actions that Russia may employ to destabilize NATO member states.
Key findings include:
1. Russian-directed sabotage attacks targeting submarine cables in the Baltic Sea have increased since 2022. 2. Moscow is likely to continue attempting to weaponize refugee flows to foment domestic unrest and exploit concerns about immigration in countries bordering Russia and Belarus. 3. The Kremlin may increase its military presence and intelligence capabilities near Finland and the Baltic states. 4. Coercive military actions via incursions into NATO airspace will likely increase ahead of the 2025 NATO Summit.
The report concludes by emphasizing that Russian hybrid threats will continue to target European critical infrastructure, particularly in countries bordering Russia, if there is no significant action regarding Ukraine.

item.title: Cybersecurity takes a big hit in new Trump executive order
item.description: FYSA: The article discusses the impact of a recent Executive Order (EO) issued by former US President Trump on cybersecurity governance and regulations. The EO rolled back several requirements aimed at improving cybersecurity, including those related to quantum-resistant algorithms, Border Gateway Protocol security, and digital identity documents. Experts warn that these changes will weaken cybersecurity efforts and create vulnerabilities in existing infrastructure.

item.title: Paddle settles for $5 million over facilitating tech support scams
item.description: Paddle.com and its US subsidiary will pay $5 million to settle FTC allegations that the company facilitated deceptive tech-support schemes that harmed many US consumers, including older adults. The schemes used fake virus alerts and pop-up warnings to lure consumers into buying unneeded software or tech support services, with Paddle processing over $37 million in transactions for affiliated merchants.

item.title: ZDI-25-398: Trend Micro Internet Security Platinum Host Service Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trend Micro Internet Security Platinum Host Service; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49384; Summary: The vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations by creating a symbolic link, which can be used to delete files. An attacker must first obtain low-privileged code execution to exploit this vulnerability, and it can be leveraged to execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-399: Fuji Electric Smart Editor V8 File Parsing Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fuji Electric Smart Editor V8; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41388; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Fuji Electric Smart Editor by exploiting a stack-based buffer overflow. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-400: Fuji Electric Smart Editor TL5 File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fuji Electric Smart Editor TL5; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32412; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Fuji Electric Smart Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and it occurs due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data that can result in a read past the end of an allocated data structure.

item.title: ZDI-25-401: Fuji Electric Smart Editor V10 File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fuji Electric Smart Editor V10; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41413; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Fuji Electric Smart Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The flaw exists in the parsing of V10 files due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-397: Delta Electronics COMMGR Insufficient Randomization Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Delta Electronics COMMGR; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3495; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of Delta Electronics COMMGR, making it possible for an attacker to exploit the system without requiring a login. The specific flaw exists within the PLC simulator service, which can be exploited through brute force attacks at moderate expense.

item.title: New Sorillus RAT Targets European Organizations Through Tunneling Services
item.description: The article describes a malicious infection chain using the Sorillus Remote Access Trojan (RAT) that targets organizations across Europe. The campaign employs invoice-themed phishing emails to deliver the malware, which uses legitimate services like OneDrive and Ngrok to evade detection.

item.title: Google Chrome Zero-Day CVE-2025-2783 Exploited by TaxOff to Deploy Trinper Backdoor
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google Chrome; CVE(s): CVE-2025-2783; Summary: A sandbox escape vulnerability (CVE-2025-2783) in Google Chrome was exploited by threat actor TaxOff to deploy a backdoor codenamed Trinper. The vulnerability had a CVSS score of 8.3 and was used as part of a phishing campaign targeting Russian organizations.

item.title: Scania confirms insurance claim data breach in extortion attempt
item.description: Scania, a major Swedish manufacturer of heavy trucks and buses, suffered a cybersecurity incident where threat actors used compromised credentials to breach its Financial Services systems and steal insurance claim documents. The attackers emailed several Scania employees, threatening to leak the data online unless their demands were met.

item.title: New KimJongRAT Stealer Uses Weaponized LNK File to Deploy PowerShell-Based Dropper
item.description: The article discusses new variants of the KimJongRAT stealer malware that emerged in 2019. These variants use a weaponized Windows shortcut (LNK) file as an initial infection vector to deploy multi-stage droppers, aiming to steal sensitive user data, including cryptocurrency wallet extensions and system information.

item.title: New Chaos RAT Variants Targeting Windows and Linux Systems to Steal Sensitive Data
item.description: Chaos RAT is a remote administration tool (RAT) that targets both Windows and Linux systems. It spreads through phishing campaigns, utilizing malicious PDF attachments embedded in emails to lure unsuspecting users into initiating the infection process. The malware grants attackers extensive control over infected systems, enabling capabilities such as keylogging, screen capture, file exfiltration, and remote command execution.

item.title: New Sophisticated Multi-Stage Malware Campaign Uses VBS Files to Execute PowerShell Script
item.description: A multi-stage malware campaign has been discovered, utilizing heavily obfuscated Visual Basic Script (VBS) files to deploy remote access trojans (RATs). The campaign involves a three-stage process of obfuscation, dynamic script generation, and remote payload downloads, highlighting the evolving tactics of modern cyber threats.

item.title: LangSmith Bug Could Expose OpenAI Keys and User Data via Malicious Agents
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: LangChain's LangSmith platform; CVE(s): None; Summary: The LangSmith platform contains a vulnerability that allows attackers to capture sensitive data, including API keys and user prompts. The vulnerability can be exploited by creating an artificial intelligence (AI) agent with a malicious proxy server, which can then intercept all user communications without the victim's knowledge.
FYSA: Threat actors have released two new variants of WormGPT, powered by xAI Grok and Mistral AI Mixtral, designed to facilitate malicious activities such as creating tailored phishing emails and writing snippets of malware.

item.title: Beware: Weaponized Research Papers Delivering Malware Through Password-Protected Documents
item.description: Kimsuky hacking organization is linked to a phishing email campaign targeting individuals with a password-protected HWP document embedded with a malicious OLE object. The attack chain includes the deployment of additional components, including executables and PowerShell scripts, designed to evade detection and establish persistent access.

item.title: Kimsuky and Konni APT Groups Lead Active Attacks Targeting East Asia
item.description: APT groups Kimsuky, Konni, Sidewinder, and Lazarus have been identified as the most active players in various regions, including East Asia, South Asia, Middle East, and Eastern Europe. These groups are using sophisticated intrusion techniques, spear phishing, and exploiting vulnerabilities to target government agencies, financial institutions, research bodies, and diplomats. The report highlights the need for enhanced threat intelligence and robust security frameworks to counter these persistent and evolving threats.

item.title: Instagram ads mimicking BMO, EQ Bank are finance scams
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Instagram; CVE(s): None; Summary: Scammers are using Instagram ads, some featuring AI-powered deepfakes, to target Canadian consumers with phishing scams and investment fraud. The ads impersonate financial institutions like Bank of Montreal (BMO) and EQ Bank, prompting users to submit personal information or banking credentials.
FYSA: Scammers are targeting Canadian consumers with Instagram ads that appear to be run by reputable financial institutions but are actually fraudulent. These ads use official branding and color schemes to drive traffic outside of the platform to illicit domains.

item.title: Instagram ads mimicking BMO, EQ Banks are finance scams
item.description: Instagram ads impersonating financial institutions like Bank of Montreal (BMO) and EQ Bank are being used to target Canadian consumers with phishing scams and investment fraud, using AI-powered deepfake videos and official branding.

item.title: Instagram 'BMO' ads use AI deepfakes to scam banking customers
item.description: Instagram ads impersonating financial institutions like Bank of Montreal (BMO) and EQ Bank (Equitable Bank) are being used to target Canadian consumers with phishing scams and investment fraud. The ads use AI-powered deepfake videos or official branding to drive traffic outside the platform to lookalike illicit domains that are not affiliated with banks, attempting to collect personal information or banking credentials.

item.title: XDSpy Threat Actors Exploit Windows LNK Zero-Day Vulnerability to Target Windows System Users
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Windows; CVE(s): ZDI-CAN-25373; Summary: The Windows LNKzero-day vulnerability (ZDI-CAN-25373) is exploited by the XDSpy threat actor to target governmental entities in Eastern Europe and Russia. The vulnerability manipulates the Windows Explorer UI to conceal malicious commands through excessive whitespace padding, allowing hidden command execution that evades user interface visibility and third-party parsers.

item.title: New Veeam RCE flaw lets domain users hack backup servers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Veeam; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23121; Summary: Veeam Backup & Replication 12 or later contains a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability that can be exploited by authenticated domain users in low-complexity attacks to gain code execution remotely on the Backup Server. The flaw only impacts domain-joined installations and was fixed in version 12.3.2.3617, which was released earlier today.

item.title: Sitecore CMS exploit chain starts with hardcoded 'b' password
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Sitecore Experience Platform (XP); CVE(s): None; Summary: A chain of three pre-auth remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities allows attackers to breach and hijack servers without authentication. The vulnerabilities hinge on an internal user with a hardcoded password, a Zip Slip flaw in the Upload Wizard, and a vulnerability in the Sitecore PowerShell Extensions (SPE) module.

item.title: UK fines 23andMe for ‘profoundly damaging’ breach exposing genetics data
item.description: The UK's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) fined genetic testing provider 23andMe £2.31 million ($3.12 million) for serious security failings that led to a data breach in 2023, exposing sensitive personal information of thousands of people in the UK and Germany.

item.title: Microsoft fixes Surface Hub boot issues with emergency update
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Surface Hub v1; CVE(s): None; Summary: The June 2025 Windows security update (KB5060533) causes startup failures for some Surface Hub v1 devices running Windows 10, version 22H2, resulting in Secure Boot Violation errors.

item.title: How to automate IT ticket handling with AI and Tines
item.description: This article is about a workflow orchestration and AI platform called Tines, specifically highlighting a pre-built ticket-handling workflow developed by Connor Brewer. The workflow aims to streamline IT issue handling by automating routine tasks, reducing manual triage, and enabling analysts to focus on more complex challenges.

item.title: Hacker steals 1 million Cock.li user records in webmail data breach
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cock.li Roundcube webmail platform; CVE(s): CVE-2021-44026; Summary: The Cock.li email hosting provider suffered a data breach after threat actors exploited an old SQL injection vulnerability in its now-retired Roundcube webmail platform, exposing over 1 million user records.

item.title: Major Cyber Attacks in Review: May 2025
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Cetus Protocol; CVE(s): None; Summary: Attackers exploited a vulnerability in the smart contract of Cetus Protocol's liquidity pools, stealing approximately $223 million in virtual assets. The flaw originated from an open-source library used in the liquidity provider's smart contract, allowing hackers to manipulate pool prices and repeatedly drain token reserves.
FYSA: LockBit was hacked, leaking thousands of Bitcoin addresses and chats. This leak offered law enforcement and analysts key data to trace ransom movements and disrupt operations, while also damaging LockBit's reputation after recent infrastructure takedowns.
Vulnerable Product: SK Shieldus; CVE(s): None; Summary: Malware in SK Shieldus software enabled the exposure of 27 million phone numbers through external Command and Control (C2) servers.
